story:
Equal Truth Productions proudly presents Aristophanes’ LYSISTRATA at 13th Street Repertory Theatre in New York City’s Greenwich Village, December 17-20, 2015. 

Who We Are

Equal Truth Productions is a New York City based theatre company that prioritizes equal representation on stage. We hope to create a space in which to foster the creative talent of people and groups whose stories are often overlooked, in an effort to accurately represent the wonderful diversity of the United States of America, and of the World. Learn more about our mission here. 

About Lysistrata

Sick and tired of the constant war in their country, Lysistrata and the women of Greece devise a sneaky, subversive plot: a sex-strike only to end upon the signing of a peace treaty. But during their protest, they are challenged by hot and heavy resistance. Can they abstain in the name of peace? 

We Want YOU

This campaign is your chance to participate in the foundation of our company as a presence in the downtown theatre world. The success of our very first show will be essential to our continuation as a company, and while we feel confident that we can create a captivating performance for our audience, we know that the level of excellence we hope to achieve can only be made possible with the help of your support.

What We Need

Our goal with this campaign is to raise funds to pay our incredibly talented team of artists and to cover the costs of renting rehearsal space and building our set. 

Current Status

We’ve made a lot of headway on the project so far. As of now, we have:

-a wonderful director

-a visionary designer

-a cast of fabulous actors

-a considerable amount of our costumes and props 

-and last but not least an amazing, historic theatre space: 13th Street Repertory Theatre

Why Lysistrata?

Although written close to 2500 years ago, LYSISTRATA is rife with political themes that are almost identical to some of the issues we face today. While being a ridiculously farcical comedy, LYSISTRATA still manages to leave a strong impression on audiences about the importance of compromise, and, when necessary, the importance of efficient protest.

There are two major reasons why we feel that LYSISTRATA is a story that needs to be told now:

  1. Compromise and the ability to reach an accord seem to be lacking entirely in the U.S. government. 

AND

  1. Omnipresent misogyny is one of the many major problems women face in the foreground of their daily lives.

LYSISTRATA shows us an uplifting way around both of these problems, primarily by reminding us that we have the power to take matters into our own hands, that we each have a voice, and that when raised in unison, our collective voice is truly formidable. 

We couldn’t be more thrilled to be staging LYSISTRATA for our inaugural production. As a company that aims to give a voice to those who often go unheard, unheeded and under-represented, we at Equal Truth Productions feel that LYSISTRATA is a perfect match for our mission, and a great choice for our big debut.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re strapped for cash and can’t donate, we ask that you spread the word about this campaign, our company and LYSISTRATA over all forms of social media.

We’d also love to see you in the audience at the show!

Equal Truth Productions is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Equal Truth Productions must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
Equal Truth Productions proudly presents Aristophanes’ LYSISTRATA at 13th Street Repertory Theatre in New York City’s Greenwich Village, December 17-20, 2015. 



Who We Are
Equal Truth Productions is a New York City based theatre company that prioritizes equal representation on stage. We hope to create a space in which to foster the creative talent of people and groups whose stories are often overlooked, in an effort to accurately represent the wonderful diversity of the United States of America, and of the World. Learn more about our mission here. 
About Lysistrata
Sick and tired of the constant war in their country, Lysistrata and the women of Greece devise a sneaky, subversive plot: a sex-strike only to end upon the signing of a peace treaty. But during their protest, they are challenged by hot and heavy resistance. Can they abstain in the name of peace? 


We Want YOU


This campaign is your chance to participate in the foundation of our company as a presence in the downtown theatre world. The success of our very first show will be essential to our continuation as a company, and while we feel confident that we can create a captivating performance for our audience, we know that the level of excellence we hope to achieve can only be made possible with the help of your support.


What We Need
Our goal with this campaign is to raise funds to pay our incredibly talented team of artists and to cover the costs of renting rehearsal space and building our set. 

Current Status
 
We’ve made a lot of headway on the project so far. As of now, we have:
-a wonderful director
-a visionary designer
-a cast of fabulous actors
-a considerable amount of our costumes and props 
-and last but not least an amazing, historic theatre space: 13th Street Repertory Theatre

Why Lysistrata?
Although written close to 2500 years ago, LYSISTRATA is rife with political themes that are almost identical to some of the issues we face today. While being a ridiculously farcical comedy, LYSISTRATA still manages to leave a strong impression on audiences about the importance of compromise, and, when necessary, the importance of efficient protest.
There are two major reasons why we feel that LYSISTRATA is a story that needs to be told now:
Compromise and the ability to reach an accord seem to be lacking entirely in the U.S. government. 
AND
Omnipresent misogyny is one of the many major problems women face in the foreground of their daily lives.
LYSISTRATA shows us an uplifting way around both of these problems, primarily by reminding us that we have the power to take matters into our own hands, that we each have a voice, and that when raised in unison, our collective voice is truly formidable. 
We couldn’t be more thrilled to be staging LYSISTRATA for our inaugural production. As a company that aims to give a voice to those who often go unheard, unheeded and under-represented, we at Equal Truth Productions feel that LYSISTRATA is a perfect match for our mission, and a great choice for our big debut.

Other Ways You Can Help 
If you’re strapped for cash and can’t donate, we ask that you spread the word about this campaign, our company and LYSISTRATA over all forms of social media.
We’d also love to see you in the audience at the show!
Equal Truth Productions is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Equal Truth Productions must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
A Short Summary...

Creating brilliant theatrical performances has always been a tradition for Malden High School's Play Production. A program that is both taught in school and worked extremely hard on after school, Play Production teaches its students every aspect of theater- from technical to acting to playwriting.
We've recently decided to focus on purchasing a lightboard that can travel for outdoor shows, that is dedicated solely to our course, and that is compatible with college/professional productions. After talking with the directors of Play Production, the class came to the conclusion that it would be best if we were to buy a new, fully functional board. 
Yet in order to fulfill the class's wish, we have to have the money to buy a new light board. Now comes the problem we face.
Now we must gather support from outside our community; to you, who maybe from a different state, country, or continent, but understand how important it is to support students in expanding and strengthening the education they receive in school.  

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to purchase a new lighting board to best serve our production needs. In return, we are offering inclusion in our program, premium seating (to see our lights) and gifts from the cast. 
Funding this project will allow us to keep our ticket prices down and the shows accessible for all community members. 
The Impact

This will benefit the community of theater students in Malden. We seek to teach students about all aspects of theater - including lighting and design. This past year, an alumni started at Emerson College for lighting design. 

Malden has a great history of theatrical productions. We have produced wonderful musicals over the past few years and look to keep the tradition alive and vital. By improving the infastructure, we can ensure great performances for this year and for years to come. 

As an urban school, funding is always tight. We survive on the donations and generosity of others. 

If you can't contribute monetarily, we are always looking for help. We regularly accept donations of costumes, set pieces, lumber, props, paint and your time. We look for help with concessions and ticket sales. 

Also, please share this link with your friends and family and co-workers. Let's light the way.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

CRITICAL POINT THEATRE was founded in 2013 by a number of purposed young artists. The goal was to create an ensemble-governed space where new works were developed, utilizing a lengthy critical process before opening. We constantly ask ourselves if the stories we select are worth telling. Rather than immediately jumping in, we like to question “why?” or “why not?”  Currently, we are in a multi-year collaborative process that is thematically exploring righteousness versus justice. CPT emphasizes transmedia approaches that look to all mediums - broadening stories that emphasize places of difference between peoples and how stories might bridge those gaps.

Along the way, we've performed at Dixon Place, the Edinburgh Fringe Festival, and off-Broadway and won the Audience Choice Award for A List of Irrational Fears for Future Leaders of the World at FRIGID New York 2014 and several AudioVerse Awards and the Rod Serling Memorial Award for our sci-fi anthology podcast The Grayscale.

OUR MISSION: We are inventors at our core. We seek to take in stories unknown, combine them with vision and action, and bring these experiences to life through performance. Our ensemble strives to pair our own development with that of changing communities. We want to stand among and between states of matter to explore beyond boundaries.

 

WHAT IS JERK?

James claims to be a sex addict. Elizabeth isn't so sure. What they do know is that neither one of them is alright. What appears to be a play about the contemptuous relationship between a patient and his doctor, devolves into madness after a sudden change in everyone's circumstances, ending in a nightmarish frenzy of self-medicating. JERK is a psychological drama about the state of monogamy in burgeoning adults. A nightmare that lies somewhere between an expressionistic dream sequence, and a series of worn out memories.

JERK was created through the hand of a singular artist, Andrew Terrance Kaberline, and washed and rinsed through a developmental process with Critical Point Theatre that encompasses the ideas, stories, and feedback from the ensemble. Our first reading of the production took place in Blacksburg, VA in 2014. During this time, the concept was wildly different than the play was now. Another stab was taken in NYC in early 2015, with a revamped script. Eventually, we held a series of feedback sessions as Andrew evolved the work, culminating in a second staged reading in Manhattan in October 2016. We've spent years seasoning JERK to perfection, and now the project is ready to simmer. We will be performing at The HIVE Art Space in Brooklyn in late August in a production led by CPT's Dylan James Amick. But as an ensemble company full of book publishers, electricians, hotel workers, and bartenders, we're hoping to gather community support in order to ensure all of our artists are paid and production costs are minimalized. That's why we are coming to you!

 

WHY DONATE?

We produce all of our shows independently, financing only from collective donations from individuals like you. It's next to impossible for artists without a long business history and legal help to obtain large grants, so we rely on small, grassroots funding campaigns like this one in order to produce our work. CPT operating costs have been funded 70% from individual giving over our four year history.

This year, we're hoping to get that extra boost from individual, small donor amounts. They say it takes a village to raise a child, and we say it takes only a small portion of the East Village to forgo a single nitro cold brew and raise an independent theatre production. Amounts of $5 are being posted here in order to get to our goal - to raise the funds we need for our base production costs. Any funds raised above these goals will go to the salaries of our actors, director, stage manager, and production help.

We're trying to stretch the breadth of our networks, not the depth of your pockets. Any amount makes a difference in pushing bold art onstage, and if you can't lend a buck or two, lend us a share on Facebook, Twitter, or Insta. We appreciate that you're living for the 'gram, and we'll help you do it.

  • If 300 people each give $5, we will have our venue cost paid.
  • If 100 people each give $15, we can get three actors their much needed due in a city where "credit and copy" doesn't pay the rent.
  • If 60 people each give $25, we make our goal and there's a pizza party. Better than the one your third grade teacher threw after you aced the spelling test.

 

ATTENDING THE PERFORMANCE

JERK is more than a performance. It's a night out in a box with a Brooklyn bow on it. If you can't donate but you're planning to come by, know that there will be food, drinks, music, and a killer way to call out the jerks in your life. To get an all-inclusive ticket (open bar? heck yeah), choose the Perf + Party option and know that your appetite for food, cocktails, and fun will be supporting the ensemble continuing to produce bold ideas in a laboratory space.

JERK runs August 24th-September 2nd, on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays at 7:30 PM, as well as 2:30 PM Saturdays.

BUY TICKETS HERE

 

GIVE US A SHOUT

We operate on

Facebook

Twitter

Instagram

Web

Critical Point Theatre Ensemble is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Critical Point Theatre Ensemble must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
The power of Veterans' stories to bridge the military-civilian divide

You're tax deductible donation will help give life to a work of art that is part of a greater project--the Veterans' Voices Initiative that I've been engaged with at the Minnesota Humanities Center. You can help bring Veterans' stories into communities to bridge the all too-wide chasm between civilian and the military members and their families who've borne the burden of the longest wars in American history. And lastly, a big thanks to my friend, Brian Turner, the amazing war poet of our generation, for lending his eloquent words to support the project.

  • I'm a writer, performer, Veteran and former Air Force Pilot. I've spent much of my adult life studying the toll of war on both the personal and societal levels.
  • I'll be performing solo, and I've been fortunate enough to team up with the amazing director, Leah Cooper, of Wonderlust Productions and Producer, Peter Hansen, of Gremlin Theater for a performance at The Bloomington Center for the Arts, Nov 10-13th (six miles from the Mall of America).
  • Over the years, I've had the pleasure of working with Veterans as they discover the power and freedom of sharing their stories, taught War Literature as a professor, lectured and performed  at the Guthrie Theater and at the Library of Congress as part of the Veterans History Project. Read more about more work HERE.
  • I recognize the importance of Veterans' stories to help society redefine their vision of the cost of war as it reverberates across generations.

I'll make it simple

We received a grant from the MN Humanities Cetner, but still need approximately $9999.

  • In short, we were hoping the grant would be much larger than it turned out, so rather than wait a year to get more funding, we decided to crowd fund. 
  • Any donation is generous and greatly appreciated, but we hope you can find a way to join in the conversation. $5, $10, $15. We'll put your name on the screen prior to every performance. But more than anything, we want a greater dialogue to continue, for Vets to be a part of that dialogue, and of course, we want these stories to be shared across communities, schools and in reading and writing groups.   
  • Any extra funding will help us to take the production into communities across Minnesota in the year ahead and possibly down the Mississippi River to St. Louis. Performance times: Nov 10-12 at 7:30 pm and Nov 13th at 1 pm.

The Impact

What will it be? I can't tell you, for certain, but all I know is that I've seen these stories change the way people view themselves, the world and those who don a uniform and serve on our nations's behalf. Stories inspire investigation and a search for deeper understanding. The Nov 13th performance will be followed by an audience talk back with the writer and a panel of Veterans.

If you can't donate 

I'm honored you took the time to check this out.  Please share the word, spread it, and remind others that we all need to hear these stories. Walk into a library and pick a book from my list of War Literature books HERE and read, read, read. Hear and share the stories of the men and women who fight on our nation's behalf.

story:
What if your tv was watching YOU...

In a reality tv show gone amok our sinister Emcee takes you on a multimedia-driven joyride to find her next unsuspecting candidate for the ultimate makeover! Award-winning video projectionist Adam Burns provides innovative techniques making the show an unforgettable multimedia theatre experience! LIPSHTICK is directed by Bricken Sparacino - one of NYTheatre.com's Theatre People of the Year!


Cast: Romy Nordlinger, Scout Durwood, Aja Houston.


We are Romy Nordlinger and Adam Burns, the playwrights of "Lipshtick" and we're delighted to have been selected from applicants WORLDWIDE to be a part of the 15th annual NY Int'l Fringe Fest. Now we need your help to get our show off the ground!!!
The Impact
This is YOUR opportunity to contribute to a smart and funny show that has something to say!


Your contribution to LIPSHTICK helps pay for:

Actors

Director

Design Team

Costumes

Props

Postcards

Publicity

Rehearsal space rental

Programs

Tech gear rental

and most importantly...a limousine with a jacuzzi in it! 

Seriously folks, we have a really tight budget and WE NEED EVERY CENT to bring this show to life!

 

 THANK YOU!!!!!!!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Learical Jonez, CEO of Learical Jonez Entertainment Group, LLC. I am a mother, writer, poet & entrepreneur.

 I began writing The Life Monologues as an outlet for friends and family. All of the monologues are real life situations that I have experienced or someone I know has gone through. I am the voice that so many are afraid to be. I believe that once you see that someone else is going through the same thing that you are, you can begin your healing process.

I have an opportunity to return to my hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana and perform The Life Monologues. This will be something that goes down in the books. Everyone is so afraid to leave the small town of Fort Wayne, but I would like to return to let them know that there is life outside.

What We Need & What You Get

I will need $3,000 to cover the expense of the trip for the cast, staff and myself. This will include travel, hotel stay and food.

If this is something that you think you would be able to help out with, you will receive recognition on the ljegroup.com website as well as a number of other places. Also if you are in the Atlanta area or surrounding cities, you will receive tickets to one of my productions.

If I dont reach my goal here on Indiegogo, I will still travel to Indiana by any means because I believe this production will help a number of people begin their healing process as it has here in Atlanta.

The Impact

The production is very powerful. During The Life Monologues March-April run, all 3 shows were standing room only. Each and every night there were patrons that approaced me after the show with tears in their eyes stating they did not know someone else had gone through something similar.  

The Life Monologues give hope. The production lets you know that although you have gone through hardship, there is sunshine at the end...and you can let it go peacefully.

Other Ways You Can Help

No contribution is too small. If you cant make a contribution, please get word to your friends, family and colleagues. Please remember to use the Indigogo share tools.

Thank you for your time and I look forward to seeing you at an LJEG production.

story:
Our Story

My name is Anthony W Johnson. I am the creator of Ballet Magique. Ballet Magique is a fusion of dance, magic, illusion, music, theatre and wushu. The performers not only dance but perform magic and illusion. We have been offered the opportunity to perform  for the Chinese New Year celebration in San Diego California. as well as other festivals abroad. 

Our goal is to raise enough capital to re-mount a spectacular performance of our show The Ring of the Rose. 

Ring of the Rose The Ring of the Rose is a passionate story of love versus obsession, beauty versus commitment and pain versus sacrifice.


In this tale of love lost, then found, everyone desires the “Rose”. 


Two couples fight with all of their might to win the love, respect, power and admiration of the Rose. As each couple vies for his desire, they eventually resort to manipulation, deception and jealous rage towards one another.  


Like so many stories we see on television shows such as “The Bachelorette”, lovelorn hopefuls, unaware of the sheer destruction caused by their own blind ambition; ultimately lose sight of the true value of the very thing that they are seeking and all of the reasons why.


Behind the masks their true heart and nature is revealed.


In the end, however, their selfish efforts prove futile as the Rose ultimately decides to honor those closest to him who have proven their respect and loyalty to him; the very thorns by his side, as it is they whom have loved and protected him all along from the ugliness which surrounds him. 


With a ring of solidarity, the Thorns teach the Rose, the couples and the audience the meaning of sacrifice, devotion and selflessness; for the rose is universally cut from it’s bush and offered each Valentine’ Day as a symbol of true love...

and for these “Thorns” their conviction forever lies within... the Ring of the Rose. 


The Ring of the Rose was first performed by Ballet Magique in Glendale CA to great success, with four Lester Horton Nominations and offers to perform the 10 minute act in various places around the world. Unfortunately as we were about to move forward Gene Wooley my former partner took ill and needed a liver transplant. He eventually, after many struggles and lots of pain, succumbed to his illness and passed away. Because this was and still is our dream, I am determined to keep his memory alive. One way I believe I can do this is to pick up where we left off, and mount the full version of Ring of the Rose for investors as well as the public who have supported us this far and use the capital from that performance to mount the tour that Gene and me always dreamed of. We are performing a 20 minute excerpt for the "Heart to Heart Hand to Hand Charity Series hosted by the the American Chinese Cultural & Education Foundation in Poway, CA held at the Poway Center for Performing Arts. Our goal is to mount the full version here in Los Angeles. We hope that you you will help us make that goal a reality!


Over the years, as a teacher, Anthony has spawned many dancers who have danced for me in Ballet Magique and gone on to fantastic careers with Cirque du Soliel, Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre on on Broadway in shows like The Lion King, Come Fly Away, Movin Out and The Color Purple, as well as tours with Janet Jackson, Christina Aguilera and Britney Spears.

Ballet Magique’s mission is to inspire dancers of all nationalities, and to create a new an exciting form of entertainment fusing not only the cultural arts but media technology and illusion.

By fusing classic art forms, including several different kinds of dance, magic, music, theatre, and visual effects, we elevate all of them to a new and glorious level that entrances all audiences even those who have seen all of our competitor’s productions. 

Ballet Magique Entertainment stands alone in the pantheon of artistic achievement and we are committed to enriching current and future generations by offering a fascinating outlook on the virtuosity of the human body, while engaging the mystique of the human psyche. 


What We Need

 The funds that we are raising here will help tl to help mount the show in Los Angeles in Memorandum to Gene Wooley.


Other Ways to Help

Ballet Magique has been very fortunate to have had overwhelming pubic support over the years for which we are extremely grateful and truly appreciate.  Every dollar raised will be spent on hard costs to put up the best show possible so we hope that you will reach out to your friends and family on our behalf and help us spread the word so that we can reach our goal and begin our new journey. By advertising space in our dynamic program.  Most of Ballet Magique’s show’s including the  Poway show is advertised all over California as well as our press release will go out through out the US and abroad.. Another way to help is our “Sponsor a Dancer Program. Please email us and we can send you all the necessary materials to join that effort

If you invest into our cause there are great perks!  Including free Caribbean Getaway! (See side panel!)

You can also see a  promotional video of our last performance of Ring of the Rose here: This performance was part of the Arabesque series at The Alex Theatre in Glendale, CA

We want to update the show and revise in memory of Gene. This will be the first performance where Ballet Magique is the only act and can finally make money. Ballet Magique has been mainly seen in festivals so we have not generated any income. Helping us will change the future success of our company. We will be using all of his music for the show's content. This video link above features two of Gene's songs tand the original cast 

http://vimeo.com/17874063 

Click on "interview with Anthony Johnson" to hear more. http://www.blogtalkradio.com/suzannewells/2011/...

story:
Our Story

Hello Indie GoGo!
Twinhead Theatre is producing Atlanta’s first Fringe Festival and we’re looking to you for help to make it happen! The Fringe tradition was born in Edinburgh, Scotland in 1947 to provide a platform for indie, underground, original theater companies and artists to show their stuff. Since then, Fringe festivals have taken over like a communist plot, popping up in lots of countries and in many major cities in the U.S. Atlanta is a perfect place to provide this platform in the Southeast, complementing our fellow Fringes in Orlando, New Orleans, and Asheville.

The Atlanta Fringe Festival has been in planning and development stages for almost two years. It’s taken us a long time to put it together because we are all volunteers with more ambitions than start-up funds. Since 2010, we’ve managed to sign on six venues, throw three events to raise friends and funds, and collect submissions from all over the country and even abroad! It's given us a really incredible, diverse lineup for our very first Fringe, representing 11 states and two countries! This festival will allow Atlanta to play host to the most exciting performance artists in the world for years to come.

We've also created a festival you can enjoy even if you're not in Atlanta. The AFF is currently the only Fringe with a radio element. We are developing a web archive of radio plays and sound art to be hosted on our website, opening us up to participation from artists and audiences who can't actually travel to the city. Other Fringes are looking to see how we set this up so they can maybe try it too! With any luck, we'll make a valuable and lasting contribution to the entire Fringe circuit!


The Impact

We have 29 productions to mount, 20 theater technicians to hire, two parties to throw, an Internet radio station to create and host, not to mention a 2013 festival to start planning.  If we don't raise this money, we won't be able to do any of that; the productions won't get what they need to be amazing, the festival's impact won't be felt as deeply, the less chance we have of lasting. This campaign is not only geared toward the success of this first year, but our second year as well: We have the future on the brain. And not just our future; the future of Fringe artists, as well. In Fringe festivals, the artists get to keep a majority of their ticket sales, putting money in artists’ pockets and a smile on their faces. Not to mention a ton of new Facebook friends and professional contacts.

What We Need & What You Get

Operation Pollination
We need to raise $10,000 to make this festival a reality! $10,000 is not an arbitrary number; that’s the amount it takes to be a Presenting Sponsor of the Atlanta Fringe Festival. We want the community to be a presenting sponsor. By turning to our community for sponsorship, our friends, our fellows, our colleagues and kin, we can plant strong roots for this Fringe to grow and last in Atlanta until the Fringe becomes a yearly tradition.

Our entire cash budget for the Atlanta Fringe is $15,000. This includes production costs for our 25 Fringe shows (including pay for fringe technicians and house managers), insurance for the festival, security for our events, merchandise procurement, any accrued miscellaneous festival costs, and best of all, a nest egg for next year. We'll be raising additional funds through submission fees and ad sales, but we have limited potential for corporate sponsorship and grants because we’re in our first year. So we turned to crowd funding-- we want the community’s investment first and always. We want YOU to pollinate our operation. (Me-yow.)

Other Ways You Can Help


We know that times are tough and not everyone can give as much as they would like to, but there's another way to help us out: spread the word! You can share our Indie GoGo page with friends, coworkers, rich uncles, wealthy nursing home residents with no living relatives, foreign dignitaries, and even high-end prostitutes with hearts of gold. Anyone can pitch in and everyone wins! So get on your Facebooks, Twitters, Gmails, Hotmails, AOLs, LOLs, and OMFG help us create the 2012 Atlanta Fringe Festival!

story:
MY STORY

 
My name is Natasha Greenblatt and my play, The Peace Maker, has been chosen for the Next Stage Festival in January of 2013. The Peace Maker is a full length political drama, filled with music and humour that immerses the audience in the world of Israel and Palestine through the eyes of one young idealist who attempts to "make peace" in the Middle East. It asks us to consider the difference between peace and justice and the seductive yet dangerous concept of dialogue. 
 
So yes, The Peace Maker is my Israel/Palestine play. It was written after I spent three months in the West Bank and throughout Israel; traveling, teaching learning, laughing, playing, crying and falling in love with the people, the politics and the heightened emotions that ran through the everyday life I experienced.
 
But it is more than that. It is also a serious attempt to create the type of political theatre that I want to see. The kind that entertains, provokes, laughs at itself and leaves it's audiences with more questions than answers, more passion than despair.
 
 

THE PLAY

 
The Peace Maker is the story of a young Canadian woman named Sophie whose desire to ‘make a difference’ ends up creating more conflict. The Peace Maker weaves together two story lines: Sophie’s experiences on Birthright, an Israeli Government sponsored trip to Israel for Jewish people under 27 in the Diaspora, and her subsequent fall from grace as a volunteer music teacher in the West Bank when she brings a group of Palestinian students to play for Holocaust survivors in Jerusalem.
 
Music plays an integral part of both the style and story of this piece. Eight musicians will play live music throughout the piece, acting as the ensemble or chorus. In the Birthright scenes they play the Israeli Defense Force soldiers that accompany the trip and in the story line set in Palestine they transform into the Horns of Freedom, the youth band that Sophie teaches.
 
 

THE FESTIVAL

 

The Peace Maker was one of ten new Canadian plays selected to appear in the Next Stage Festival. Next Stage is curated by the fine people that run the Toronto Fringe: http://fringetoronto.com/next-stage-festival/
 
It is an exciting festival, filled with a awesome array of shows and I am honoured to be a part of it this year. But this show isn't a small task. It has musicians, a large cast and a multi-faceted story that tackles one of the biggest political dilemmas of our time. So... 
 
 

THE TEAM

 
I have assembled a formidable team to help me with this mission:
 
Jennifer Brewin is a veteran theatre director and the Artistic Director of Theatre Columbus. Last year she won the Dora award for Independent Director for her production of The Story. Glenn Davidson is a celebrated lighting and set designer, who has designed for theatre, ballet, chamber music and rock shows and is the recipient of the Pauline McGibbon Award. Musical Director Samuel Sholdice is a quickly emerging force in Toronto, designing and composing for Native Earth, the Blyth Festival and SummerWorks Festival. And costume and prop designer, Lindsay Code just came back from the wilds of Cow Head, Newfoundland, where she's served four years as Head of Wardrobe/Resident Designer for the Gros Morne Theatre Festival.
 
The production features the incredible talents of: Rebecca Auerbach, Jeff Irving, Sam Khalilieh, Michael Rubenfeld, Harveen Sandhu, Razi Shawahdeh and Maryem Tollar.
 
And me? I am an actress, writer, and now producer! That's how it often works in our community, you have to do it all if you want it done. But it takes a village to raise a child (or so I've been told) and this is where you can help.
 
 

THE IMPACT

We have applied for grants to pay the artists and are hosting a huge fundraiser on Toronto Island: (http://mad.ly/839023) but we need help raising initial start up funds to build the set, buy the costumes, rent rehearsal space and make our posters. Anything you can give will help us make this production the best it can be. If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please consider spreading the word. And most importantly, come see our show!
 
The Peace Maker plays at the Factory Mainspace Theatre as part of the Next Stage Festival, January 2nd to 13th.

story:
Short Summary

 

We are Birdsnest Theatre, we are passionate about creating exciting theatre for children under 5 and their adults. 

Our work is very design led and always contains live music. We believe that children should have accessibility and opportunities to experience high quality theatre created especially for them.  We create a striking and simple aesthetic in intimate spaces.  Where children and their accompanying adult can get lost in the world of their imagination together, where props and set are thoughtfully designed, beautifully made and integral to the their experience. We want to give the audience the sense that their imagination is bringing the space to life to reveal secrets and surprises.  We believe A child’s experience of theatre should be welcoming, inclusive, tangible and interactive.  

The founders of Birdsnest Theatre are Beth and Emily. Between us we have experience in theatre, schools, the music industry, visual art and performance. Now with young families of our own, we are inspired to make our own theatrical experiences for the very young. We are based in the UK and will also tour other European countries in the coming year.

Birdsnest like happy faces; Something out of nothing; magical moments; beautiful things; simplicity; surprising people; playing; playing with words; sounds; rhythms; touching things; sharing; intriguing spaces; journeys; stories.

Birdsnest would like lots of people to join in. As many as possible. We believe in exploring the world through the magic of theatre.

Birdsnest know that the best way to create great theatre is  to learn from children and so we always involve children's groups in our devising processes through workshops and residencies. We get children involved before their theatre visit. We invite children to stay and play after our shows.

Blown Away, a show for 3-5 year olds is Birdsnest's first project, developed with the generous support of The Arts Council England and Trestle Arts Base in 2011. The strength of the work created earned the invaluable support from established theatre's and theatre companies who are themselves committed to creating excellent theatre for children. Through artistic and business mentoring as well as support in kind we have been generously supported by The Polka Theatre for Children, Oily Cart and The Royal and Derngate Theatre.

We are now at a stage where we have fee and accommodation costs to meet in order to ensure this exciting show is seen in theatres, community spaces and children's centres across the country.

We urgently need money to cover the costs of our rehearsal period and upcoming tour. Our tour will take us to the Take Off festival in Durham, Lincoln Drill Hall, rural venues in Shropshire through Arts Alive, Polka Theatre, The Albany Deptford as well as many more. The Take Off Festival of Theatre for Children and Young People is England's leading sector development event for those working in the field of theatre for young audiences.  We know that giving Blown Away this platform will ensure interest in the show, bringing with it further touring opportunities.  Tours beyond this will then begin to fund themselves. This tour will incorporate Children's Centres and community centers, giving families who may not usually have access to the arts an opportunity to experience excellent theatre for children. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have brought together a dedicated team of talented artists to create this wonderful show and allocated three weeks of rehearsal time in which to do it.  The rehearsal space has been generously donated to us at no cost by Polka Theatre and Royal and Derngate Theatres but we still need to cover the cost of fees, transport and accommodation of the artists, that is the actors, musical director, director, designer, writer and stage manager. 

We have a range of exciting perks with which to incite you to donate! From hand printed Birdsnest tote bags created lovingly by a granny in Skipton to a chance to have your very own Blown Away party! Have a look at our perks on the side of this page to see which take your fancy. But straight donations without the perks will be also be gratefully received!

We don't have any photos available yet of the products you can buy as they are being made now, but if you go to the image section of this campaign you will see some drawings of the designs.  

 

If we do not manage to reach our entire goal we will cut fees, namely our own.  we are committed to this project and believe so completely in it's importance that we are willing to sacrifice our own fees. 

The Impact

Ensuring our audiences receive the very highest quality of theatre means time spent in rehearsals, this costs money in fees transport and accommodation.  We believe strongly in paying our artistic team properly with fees which reflect the value of the work they do.  All the artistic team will be paid rates approved and recommended by equity.  

This project is valuable as it offers children and their families a rare opportunity to come together in a space created especially for them.  This work creates an opportunity to take time out of our busy technology filled worlds and get lost in a world of wonder, magic and shared experience.  

Birdsnest have received such positive endorsement from experienced practitioners in this field we are just one step away from getting this show off the ground and out to children across the Uk.  

Our tour will take us to the Take Off festival in Durham, we know that giving Blown Away this platform will ensure interest in the show, bringing with it further touring opportunities.  

This plea for support is to develop the show and cover rehearsal and touring costs. Your contribution to this campaign will mean we can get Blown Away off the ground. Making it possible for children and their carers across the country to see this wonderful piece of work by an exciting new company.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone is able to contribute but you can also help us out by spreading the word. Please pass this on to everyone you know, put it up on your facebook page, tweet about it, anything you can think of to spread the word.

Thank you very much!

Birdsnest would like lots of people to join in. As many as possible. We believe in exploring the world through the magic of theatre.
Birdsnest know that the best way to create great theatre is  to learn from children and so we always involve children's groups in our devising processes through workshops and residencies. We get children involved before their theatre visit. We invite children to stay and play after our shows.
Blown Away, a show for 3-5 year olds is Birdsnest's first project, developed with the generous support of The Arts Council England and Trestle Arts Base in 2011. The strength of the work created earned the invaluable support from established theatre's and theatre companies who are themselves committed to creating excellent theatre for children. Through artistic and business mentoring as well as support in kind we have been generously supported by The Polka Theatre for Children, Oily Cart and The Royal and Derngate Theatre.
We are now at a stage where we have fee and accommodation costs to meet in order to ensure this exciting show is seen in theatres, community spaces and children's centres across the country.
We urgently need money to cover the costs of our rehearsal period and upcoming tour. Our tour will take us to the Take Off festival in Durham, Lincoln Drill Hall, rural venues in Shropshire through Arts Alive, Polka Theatre, The Albany Deptford as well as many more. The Take Off Festival of Theatre for Children and Young People is England's leading sector development event for those working in the field of theatre for young audiences.  We know that giving Blown Away this platform will ensure interest in the show, bringing with it further touring opportunities.  Tours beyond this will then begin to fund themselves. This tour will incorporate Children's Centres and community centers, giving families who may not usually have access to the arts an opportunity to experience excellent theatre for children. 
What We Need & What You Get


We have brought together a dedicated team of talented artists to create this wonderful show and allocated three weeks of rehearsal time in which to do it.  The rehearsal space has been generously donated to us at no cost by Polka Theatre and Royal and Derngate Theatres but we still need to cover the cost of fees, transport and accommodation of the artists, that is the actors, musical director, director, designer, writer and stage manager. 
We have a range of exciting perks with which to incite you to donate! From hand printed Birdsnest tote bags created lovingly by a granny in Skipton to a chance to have your very own Blown Away party! Have a look at our perks on the side of this page to see which take your fancy. But straight donations without the perks will be also be gratefully received!
We don't have any photos available yet of the products you can buy as they are being made now, but if you go to the image section of this campaign you will see some drawings of the designs.  
 
If we do not manage to reach our entire goal we will cut fees, namely our own.  we are committed to this project and believe so completely in it's importance that we are willing to sacrifice our own fees. 
The Impact


Ensuring our audiences receive the very highest quality of theatre means time spent in rehearsals, this costs money in fees transport and accommodation.  We believe strongly in paying our artistic team properly with fees which reflect the value of the work they do.  All the artistic team will be paid rates approved and recommended by equity.  
This project is valuable as it offers children and their families a rare opportunity to come together in a space created especially for them.  This work creates an opportunity to take time out of our busy technology filled worlds and get lost in a world of wonder, magic and shared experience.  
Birdsnest have received such positive endorsement from experienced practitioners in this field we are just one step away from getting this show off the ground and out to children across the Uk.  
Our tour will take us to the Take Off festival in Durham, we know that giving Blown Away this platform will ensure interest in the show, bringing with it further touring opportunities.  
This plea for support is to develop the show and cover rehearsal and touring costs. Your contribution to this campaign will mean we can get Blown Away off the ground. Making it possible for children and their carers across the country to see this wonderful piece of work by an exciting new company.


Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate that not everyone is able to contribute but you can also help us out by spreading the word. Please pass this on to everyone you know, put it up on your facebook page, tweet about it, anything you can think of to spread the word.
Thank you very much!

story:
"In Case of Counterpoint"

 

Our Story:

During their years as principal dancers with Oregon Ballet Theatre, Artur and Gavin were frequently paired together.  Their movement styles, musicality, and dramatic instincts outweighed their physical differences (he's a whole foot taller than she is), and they developed an artistic partnership that deeply resonated with audiences.  Although they performed together for seven seasons with OBT, their opportunities to dance together were cut short when Gavin retired from OBT in 2010.  Interestingly enough, however, Artur's own retirement from the company in spring 2012 opened the door for partnership again.


They decided to follow their instincts (and listen to a gnawing sense that something was missing from a life without performance) and create opportunities of their own to work on choreography, hone new techniques, and perform for audiences.  Now that Artur and Gavin are both full-time ballet teachers, their focus and approach to their own dancing has shifted slightly, each of them looking at technique, partnering, dependency, and interdependency almost as new people- certainly as new artists.

 

In August of 2012, Gillmer Duran, resident choreographer and artistic director of Alaska Dance Theater, came to Portland to create a new pas de deux for Gavin and Artur.  With music by Steve Reich and Acid Lounge, "In Case of Counterpoint" is a dance in three sections, each exploring different shades of human relationships.  Gillmer describes his creation this way:

"Counterpoint is a relationship between musical themes that are harmonically interdependent, but independent in rhythm and contour.  I decided to analyze this concept by visually integrating patterns with different kinds of alignments, symmetries and speeds within the context of human interaction".


The experience of working with Gillmer was amazing-- in four days, he layered movement on top of, within, and around complementary shapes as well as contrasting ones, and created an 8-minute duet that alternately soars and whispers.  Long lines and fluidity unexpectedly end in crumples and re-emerge in conversations between the two dancers.  By the end, the viewers will be left wondering what it really means to be "independent"...

What We Need & What You Get:


Gavin and Artur will perform "In Case of Counterpoint" as part of an evening of dance by Northwest choreographers at the BodyVox theater on November 16 and 17, 2012.  They must cover all the costs associated with the creation of the pas de deux and its performance themselves, and are looking to YOU-- their fans from the past, friends old and new, dance and art lovers who want to support the creation of new ballets on seasoned professionals, and who are taking a leap into not just their own futures, but that of dance in our region.  You will also be supporting the work of choreographer Gillmer Duran by making it possible for his creation to be seen by a wider audience.

 

Our Costs:

  • Choreographer's fee, travel expenses, and lodging
  • Rental of performance venue
  • Costume rental
  • Promotional materials

Your Impact:


Your contribution will actually do more than just enable this performance to take place-- you will be voicing your support of Artur and Gavin's initiative to continue along this path of commissioning choreography and performing it in unique, local venues.  We want to go further, but cannot keep pushing forward without knowing we can count on our supporters to go along with us!

Please show us that you support our belief that dance needs to happen, always, that dancers must share their work in order to stay alive.  Your contribution to our campaign will be our inspiration to go on! 

 

See Your Financial Support Come to Life:


"Pacific Dance Makers" will feature Artur and Gavin performing "In Case of Counterpoint" by Gillmer Duran, as well as works by choreographers Tracey Durbin, Candace Bouchard, Lauren Edson, and Eowyn Emerald Barrett.  The performances will be Friday, Nov. 16 at 7:30, and Saturday, Nov. 17 at 6:00 and 8:00, at the BodyVox Theater (1201 NW 17th Ave., Portland, OR 97209).  Tickets are $20, general seating, available for purchase at the door at the time of the performance, or online at:

http://eowynbarrett.com/buy-tickets/

Please come see this stylisticly and asthetically diverse collection of dancers and choreographers perform in the wonderful setting of the BodyVox Theater!

story:
Dear Friends, Family and Soon to be Loved Ones,

aWe Creative Group is thrilled to announce the premiere of Amy E. Witting's play FALLING at The New York International Fringe Festival. Not only are we truly excited to have this special piece produced, but also hope that you will be able to come see it. 
 
We need help to make sure this show happens, and we look to our supporters to see that it does.
 

Who is aWe Creative Group?

aWe Creative Group was founded in 2005 by Amy E. Witting and her constant collaborators, Kerry Fitzgibbons and Billy Weimer. In 2009, the quartet was complete when Amy met Tiffany May McRae teaching theater in Ecuador with Dramatic Adventure Theater. Together they produced and performed the widely acclaimed show, GI Joe Jared, which was performed both in New York City and the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2011. All four artists are committed to make exciting original theater that will not only move their audience but will also, hopefully, make people think in a different way. aWe is also responsible for the wildly succesful 24Hour PlayFun, which encourages like minded writers, directors, and actors to get on their feet and create!

 
So, what do we need?

Well, to be completely honest $3126.00. That may seem like an odd number, but here's why- we want to be realistic and practical about the amount of money we need. Production details like lighting, costumes, programs, rehearsal space, makeup, insurance, and books (when you see the show this item will make sense) all cost money and add up.

As a reminder aWe Creative Group is fiscally sponsored by Fractured Atlas, which allows your donations to be tax deductible. With your donations, we want to give you more than just our undying gratitude. If you look to the right, you will see what we can give back. You will also notice how your money helps the production move forward. Please do not feel that you must abide by those standards, any contribution makes the world of difference.

What is FALLING?

FALLING is drama focusing on a tragic love story that explores the ethical questions about the vows of marriage and the basic functions of the heart. Sometimes we simply cannot control where our love goes. What chances are you willing to take to be happy?

Who is FALLING?

Amy E. Witting, playwright

Jacob Titus, Director

Miriam Cortez*, Stage Manager

Cast- Josh Bywater*, Kerry Fitzgibbons, Janine Kyanko*, Tiffany May McRae, Billy Weimer and Elanna White

*appearing courtesy of Actors' Equity Association

If you can't contribute, we still love you!

We completely understand not being able to donate and the last thing we want is for you to feel is harassed by this campaign. We just want you to see it and for your friends to see it. So spread the word, that's more than we could ever hope for!

The details:

Website: www.fallingtheplay.com

Theater: Connelly Theater- Fringe Venue #2, 220 E. 4th St., NYC

Dates: Friday August 10th 8:45pm

         Sunday August 12th 12:00pm

         Wednesday August 15th 9:00pm

         Friday August 24th 2:00pm

         Sunday August 26th 4:00pm

We really hope to see you there!

story:
Hello my name is Alieesah and I am the artistic director of Exotic Dance Central Dance Studio in New York City. 

Exotic Dance Central Dance Studio has grown tremendously over the years with the continued support of our students, family and friends. Due to irreconcilable differences with our current landlord, we will not be renewing our current lease.  However this is a New Year and we are ready to embark on a new endeavor and take EDC Dance Studio to the next level by expanding into a new larger state of the art facility to accomodate our growth. With our Indiegogo campaign we need to raise $150,000 to cover a portion of the rent, dance studio build out, advertising, furniture, supplies and to complete all of the finishing touches in order to re-open in February 2013.

This indiegogo campaign is very important to us and by you joining our dance community and making a contribution you are helping us to reach our goal to expand awareness and continue to create an outlet for people to exotic dance their way to get fit, feel sexy, have fun and to bridge the gap in the dance community to show that exotic dance is a multi disciplinary art form that embodies confidence, defies gravity and pushes creative boundaries.

 

Who Is EDC Dance Studio Inc?

Exotic Dance Central Dance Studio (EDC Dance Studio)  is New York City's 1st dance studio and lifestyle facility to exclusively offer exotic dance and pole dancing classes, workshops, private parties and social events for women, men and couples since 1999. We provide the New York City community with a comfortable, non-judgemental and friendly environment in which to learn various forms of exotic dance to empower themselves 7 days a week. We have trained some of the world's top instructors, competitors and performers in the United States and abroad.  We have taken dance styles such as; modern, ballet, jazz, hip hop and partner dance to the next level by incorporating pole dance and exotic dance, as a sport, as well as an art form.

What We Need & What You Get

Exotic Dance Central Dance Studio needs to raise $150,000 for a new state of the art facility. Below is a breakdown of how the money will be used:

  • Studio Buildout:Lay a sprung-wood sound proof dance floor, build multiple sound proof dance rooms, dressing/locker rooms, bathrooms, office space, supply room, snack bar and store. Track lighting installation
  • Equipment & Materials: 2 Desk Top Computers For Reception, 2-Self Service Computers For Student Kiosk, New Updated Sound and Security System, New & Improved Dance Poles, Full Length Mirrors, Yoga & Pole Mats)
  • Painting: Full paint job for the entire facility
  • Furniture: Reception Desk, Lounge & Stack Chairs, Lockers, Display Case & Hanging Racks).
  • Supplies: Office Supplies, Classroom Supplies, Party Supplies, Snack Bar & Store Supplies.
  • Advertising: Window Signage, Promotional Videos, Web Design w/Online Booking & Scheduling Modules & Online Dance Instruction Capabilities and Business Literature.

If We Reach Our Goal: If we reach our goal we will be able to continue to grow exotic dance in the NYC area as well as expand this passionate art form worldwide. Contributions in any amount is greatly appreciated and perks will be honored and can be redeemed in a timely fashion.

If We Exceed Our Goal: If we exceed our goal this will be great as we will use the additional funds to make Exotic Dance Central Dance Studio even better allowing us to expand and increase worldwide popularity with online classes, online instructor training and forums.

What Happens If We Do Not Reach Our Goal: If we do not reach our goal we will be charged a 9% Indiegogo fee for the amount we raised.  We will use the funds that we have raised for the new facility as well as continue to fundraise and seek other avenues of financing.

Our Unique & Exotic Perks:

EDC Dance Studio is offering some fun, unique and exotic perks for our contributors to Exotic Dance Your Way 7 days at week in our new home in New York City, nationally or internationally online.

Contributors Get The Ultimate Exotic Dance Experience to Exotic Dance Your Way, Get Fit, Feel Sexy & Have Fun With Our Exotic Perks. These are samples below perks may differ however not significantly.

Add - On an additional $5 for delivery in the United States. If perks have to be mailed Internationally please add-on an additional $15 for delivery.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would like to thank you for taking the time to read our campaign. We are aware that some people may not be able to make a financial contribution however you can still contribute to our campaign by doing any one or more of the following below:

  • Share Our Campaign: Help spread the word to all your friends by forwarding our indiegogo campaign information to your twitter, facebook and any social media platforms you are a part of. 
  • Indiegogo Share Tools: Help spread the word about our campaign using Indiegogo shared tools. 
  • EDC Website: Join our dance community at www.danceyourwaynyc.com
  • Read Our Online Reviews: http://www.customerlobby.com/reviews/17045/edc-dance-studio/

story:
The Breakdown:

We are Therese Barbato and Mary Wiseman, both second year students at the Juilliard School and huge fans of the play God's Ear by Jenny Schwartz. The impetus for this project was our mutual love of the play and our desire to share it with a broader community.

God's Ear is the story of a young family trying deperately to recover after the loss of their eight year-old son. Ms. Schwartz uses heightened and stylized text to illuminate how paltry language is in the face of unspeakable grief.

Nina Steiger, director of the Writer's Center at Soho Theatre, London said of God's Ear:

"The play presents a mosaic; each of it's tiles offer grace notes of misunderstanding, odd applications of every day idioms, overturned cliches, and phantom lines from one character in the mouth of another. What emerges from the fragments is a compelling portrait of grief and recalibration. It's a perfect snapshot of a family in transition and it articulates aspects of the human heart and the modern condition.

God's Ear is directed by Lee Sunday Evans and stars: Noah Averbach-Katz, Therese Barbato, Alex Breaux, Brandon Hall, Vella Lovell, Mallory Portnoy, and Mary Wiseman

 

What We Have and What We Need From You

Thus far we have raised $700 in funding from The Juilliard School. We have $500 left to raise before we reach our goal. Now we are reaching out to you to close the gap!

Your generous support will help us:

  • Provide honorariums for our Stage Manager and Director
  • Fufill our basic costume requirments
  • Contibute to essential set and prop elements
  • Create publicity materials and programs

All funders are guaranteed a seat for God's Ear and acknowledgement in our program.

 

We feel passionately about this play and its place in the greater artistic landscape. Please help us bring God's Ear to life!

story:
Vault

is Amy Ell’s newest dance endeavor.  With her masterful cohorts, she explores multifaceted movement encompassing the entire performance space.  The results challenge convention and gravity alike, capturing a delicate sense of timelessness and freedom.  Timelessness that allows us to stop and be aware.  Freedom to expand within the natural world around us.


Amy Ell

is the mother of Area Dance, dance in any particular extent of space or on any surface. She is the Artistic Director of Vault, and the owner/director of GYROTONIC® Houston (soon to become VAULT), a facility providing instruction in aerial fabric, trapeze, harness/wall dancing, Pilates, and GYROTONIC®.


Excerpts from ConTornTion were performed at Frenetic Theater (Houston, Texas), SpaceTaker’s Gala at Spring Street Studios (Houston, Texas), and on the outside wall of the MJC in La Baule, France earlier this year.  The wall excerpt will be performed, as a teaser, at Miller Outdoor Theater on September 23 and 24, 2011.  ConTornTion can be seen in its entirety at DiverseWorks on September 29, 30, and October 1, 2011.  

See you there!


What We Need:

We are investing in proper rigging equipment and expertise.  We are purchasing 5 double pic harnesses (hmmm....sounds very techinical....feeling more and more like a real life stunt woman....these are harnesses with 'pick up' on the sides that we then attach to another strap so we can move side to side then we clip into rope or bungee depending on the piece....oy, are you following me?).  We need lots and lots of rope.....enough for 6 lines:  3 for the harness peeps and 3 for bungee peeps.  We are using a local rigger for basic setup and then bringing in a a rigger from LA.....a Cirque du Soleil rigger no less to help us with rehearsals and for the show.  We will be paying 3 riggers or rigger type people to work the show.  I am also bringing in a dancer from LA to perform with Vault.  So.....I have 2 out of town guests to provide flight for and fees (they are staying with friends, whew!).  We already have the rigging for the wall piece (but need more rope otherwise it's hard to stay up there....you know....without the rope).  I have to purchase thousands of marbles for 'Continuum' and a few more costumes.  'Torn' needs all new costuming (we have costumes for outside performance but they don't work in a black box theater). 

....so, come fly with us as we approach opening night....help where you can....if you can!

Other Ways You Can Help

ooooo doggie....we would love help in any form!!!!

Send this out to all your pals and family....post this on your Facebook or Linkedin accounts.....help us get the word out.  We are really doing something different and unusual!

....or volunteer....contact catalina@gyrotonichouston.com if you would like to help in person and participate in the process!
story_txt:
Vault
is Amy Ell’s newest dance endeavor.  With her masterful
cohorts, she explores multifaceted movement encompassing the entire performance
space.  The results challenge convention and gravity alike, capturing a
delicate sense of timelessness and freedom.  Timelessness that allows us
to stop and be aware.  Freedom to expand within the natural world around
us.

Amy Ell
is the mother of Area Dance, dance in any particular extent of space or on any surface. She is the Artistic Director of Vault, and the owner/director of GYROTONIC® Houston (soon to become VAULT), a facility providing instruction in aerial fabric, trapeze, harness/wall dancing, Pilates, and GYROTONIC®.





Excerpts from ConTornTion were performed at Frenetic Theater (Houston, Texas), SpaceTaker’s
Gala at Spring Street Studios (Houston, Texas), and on the outside wall of the MJC in La Baule, France earlier this year.  The wall excerpt will be performed, as a teaser, at Miller Outdoor Theater on September 23 and 24, 2011.  ConTornTion can be seen in its entirety at DiverseWorks on September 29, 30, and October 1,
2011.  
See you there!

....so, come fly with us as we approach opening night....help where you can....if you can!

story:
Our Story

Levente is a fat Hungarian man-child.  He is getting married on "the third of labor day", as he put it.  Let's make sure he has the time of his life before it is "game over".

Stay-tuned for the exact date!  I should know very soon.


The Impact

We will all have fun and Levente will be full of pure happiness before his big day.


What We Need & What You Get

Look, in order to make this party the best it can be, I thought it might be good to have a pool of funds to pay for stuff like dancers, booze and food.  That way, I don't have to worry about collecting money from everyone at the party and we can all just have a good time.

I think that if we all kick in $50-$100...or whatever you are comfortable with, we can actually afford some fun theatrical entertainment at least.


Other Ways You Can Help

there are no other ways to help.  It is a bachelor party for our friend.  Let's do this.

story:
Our Story

Valor-Visions Theater company began in January 2012. We are a new company but we have very big dreams. It was founded by me, Tracey Pope, after my decision to resign from my job and step out on faith in order to pursue my dreams. I have always dream of walking in my mom's footsteps and becoming a great playwright and director. Right now, our office is run from my home, but I dedicate more hours to working for my own company at home than I did when I worked full-time outside of my home. I am passionate about my company and our current project, Mama's Child. It is a comical, but serious gospel musical about family life, drug addiction, loss and forgiveness. We plan to have a top-notch band, moving music, and a powerful message that will wow our audience.

 

The Impact

The impact that Mama's Child will have on the community comes in the form of 2 deep moral messages: As long as you still have life, you still have hope; and Forgiveness is the purest kind of love you can exercise.  The vocals and the music is what will help to get this message across in the most effective way. Proceeds from this play will go to a pre-selected charity - tentatively The Boys & Girls Club of NC. We will involve the community in every step of this production from auditions to charity donations.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Below is our standing budget for the production:

 

Budget:

 

Royalties

none

N/A

Scripts

$100.00

25 scripts @ $.10 per page

40 pages

Set Designer & Set

$600.00

Assuming we will be able to borrow small props and/or set pieces from NCCU Theater

Costumes

$0.00

To be donated on May 1, 2012 by Thrift World of Knightdale, NC

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
Our Story

Inkling Productions has recently become the first UK company to be granted the rights to THE EXONERATED since its debut in 2006. We plan to mount a 4-week production of the piece in March 2011 that is loyal and honest to the text itself, but delivered with a significantly different approach as compared to the last time it was seen by a British audience.

Inkling Productions has thus far successfully produced two pieces of new writing to critical acclaim, while under the previous guise of “Inkling Media”. Following the success of these works, and following the exciting opportunity that has just been offered to the company based on this success (to mount our production on a high-impact central London stage), we are looking to expand our approach to include both new writing and previously performed texts across all genres. 

Jaclyn McLoughlin (our director) has most recently directed BIG SHOE at the King’s Head Theatre, and THE COMMON GOOD at the Arcola Theatre. Jackie also Assistant Directed WET WEATHER COVER earlier in the year, and followed the production on its West End transfer to the Arts Theatre.

Kate Monro (our producer) is a former civil service project manager. Over the past year, Kate has executive produced not only Inkling Productions, but also Paper Balloon Theatre Company, which focuses on devised children’s productions. Kate’s skills in producing extend across the fields of theatre, as her success stems from an ability to establish long-term relationships and eager support of the work that is being done under her leadership. She has produced a number of pieces for Scrawny Cat Theatre Company as well, including THIS COULD BE THE LAST TIME, an original site-specific piece based on the history of St. Andrew’s Holborn during the blitz; and UNACKNOWLEDGED ACTS OF DESIRE, which was commissioned by the V&A Museum and inspired by works of art held within it during their ‘Making a Scene’ event in 2009.

The Impact

We aim to produce at least one production every year which ties in directly with a charity of our choice. This past year, a portion of our proceeds from THE COMMON GOOD benefited the Chernobyl Children’s Lifeline, with whom we partnered leading up to the production. And this upcoming year, a portion of our proceeds from THE EXONERATED will benefit Amnesty International, with whom we are also partnering.

Inkling Media is completely committed to not only producing a piece of strong artistic merit, but also to using this opportunity to draw attention to the human rights issues raised in the play. We are collaborating with Amnesty International to develop a partnership that will raise the profile of Amnesty's work in this area. We intend to hold a benefit performance to raise proceeds for Amnesty's campaign for abolishing the death penalty, as well as a series of post-show functions (guest speakers, expert forums etc) to draw attention to this work. 

Inkling Media is also in discussion with a range of human rights defenders from the legal world and Reprieve and is seeking their input for these events.

Although THE EXONERATED focuses on the death penalty in the US, we strongly believe that the issues transcend its immediate location. We need look only at the case of Linda Carty, a 51-year-old British citizen currently awaiting execution in Texas, and still pleading her innocence, to see that capital punishment on American soil can still reach British land. And we need only to look at the case of Sakineh Mohammadi Ashtiani, a 43-year-old woman who just barely escaped execution by stoning in Iran earlier this year to see that capital punishment in its many forms occurs in countries and cultures throughout the world. 

THE EXONERATED is not only an outstanding piece of writing, it is also an important piece of theatre that shines a light on a very real, important and urgent human rights issue that we are dedicated to maximising during the course of the production.

Amnesty International is being provided with an allotment of tickets for people in need with whom they have been working as well, and we will also be offering a discounted ticket option for members of select communities who would otherwise have difficulty affording West End theatre prices - i.e., school groups, asylum seekers, unemployed. Our intent is for our production and its educational value to be accessible to everyone, and to once again invite people back into a welcoming theatre.

While learning where to find further information in these areas, our audience members will also be reminded of the strength of the human spirit that they have just witnessed within every character of THE EXONERATED. Every one of our characters are real people, still alive today. And every one of them are living icons of the strength of the human spirit to overcome the most grave of injustices in life. We intend for our audiences to leave with a pride and a reaffirmation in their fellow beings, as well as an awareness of the issues at hand.

What We Need & What You Get

In total we need to raise close to £23,000 ($36,269 US dollars) to fund this production, however we are only seeking $8,000 through the Indiegogo forum. We are also fundraising through private sources - human rights law firms, for example - and through public funding sources in the UK. Every little helps, which is why we are using Indiegogo!

This money will go directly towards the costs of staging this production - actor's fees, venue hire, publicity, set building, lighting design. Some of these costs will obviously be covered by income from ticket sales, but there is a shortfall which needs to be raised in order to cover up-front costs.

Neither our director or producer are taking an upfront fee for this work and will only be paid on a profit share basis.

story:
FOR YOUR CONSIDERATION

The ballots are out for the 2013 Primetime Emmys Awards.  I am Ally Calloway and with the help of my sister Ashley Calloway we want to help our mom, actress Vanessa Bell Calloway, earn a 2013 Primetime Emmys Award nomination for her work on Showtime's hit show Shameless, by hosting a screening for Emmy voters.

A SHAMELESS SCREENING

To help our mom, actress Vanessa Bell Calloway, earn an "Outstanding Actress in a Guest Role" Emmy nomination we will host a screening of an episode of Shameless for members of the Television Academy to inspire them to vote for Vanessa. Your contribution will help offset the cost of the screening and greatly increase Vanessa's chances of earning a nomination. Of course there are no guarantees but our best opportunity to secure a nomination is to host a screening and to do so we need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,500 to cover the cost of the screening, pre-event promotions and a small post reception.

In return for your support you will receive:

Autographed "That's So Very Vanessa" T-Shirt - $50 Donation

An Autographed Photo - $100 Donation

Vanessa Records Your Voicemail Message -  $200 Donation  (on your voicemail)

Lunch with Vanessa - $750 Donation

Work Out with Vanessa - $1000 Donation

ALL PROCEEDS WILL BE USED TO HOST THE SCREENING AND POST EVENT. IN THE EVENT IF THERE ARE ANY REMAINING FUNDS, WHICH ARE NOT USED FOR THE SCREENING, THOSE PROCEEDS WILL BE DONATED TO SUPPORT BREAST CANCER AWARENESS.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to make a financial contribution, but you can still support this effort. Please help raise awareness of our campaign by sharing it on social media! Post our link on your Facebook and Twitter. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to ensure your followers to go to our page on Indiegogo!!

Thank you in advance for your support,

Ally & Ashley Calloway!

story:
QUICK UPDATE: The due date for this indiegogo campagin is only for the campagin and does not reflect the actual date that Zach will be leaving for New York. 

I am making a little campagin for my bestest friend in the whole world, Zach Counsil, who has been asked to attend a call back audition for the broadway hit musical "The Book of Mormon" in New York City. I really want for him to be able to sieze this wonderful opportunity.

 This campagin will be helping raise money for:

  • Travel
  • Lodging
  • Transportation 

They have requested that Zach come down for 2 days so if they require a second meeting with him they can have it.

Any funds generated by this campagin will be of great assistance.
Your donnations are very much appreciated. Thank you so much for helping with this campagin.

 

We wish Zach all the best in getting to New York City!

For more info about Zach, visit his personal website at www.zachcounsil.com
